i cannot suggest this game for new players until value does something to permanently get rid of the bots. i don't care about cheaters right now, but waves of aim bots flooding servers make it borderline unplayable unless people are already in the servers. to any new people wanting to try this game, i wish you luck trying to find a casual server that doesn't have any bots or cheaters.
Edit: it seems like the bot problem has only gotten worse with a type of bot that can fully crash servers, i have so far ran into them 2 times making me re queue to a new server. until value does anything about this just use community servers if you wanna play.

Imagine a game where the most degenerate parts of every people group imaginable - those you agree with, those you consider the scum between your toes, those you've never heard of and wish you could un-know after hearing about them - imagine them all a part of one ridiculous circus of a fanbase, but instead of fighting like they do in a Reddit or Twitter thread or even like a Call of Duty lobby, they mess around like children and all laugh at their degeneracy. When you play this game, you'll see this very juxtaposition of hell and paradise that I have described. Have fun!

primero te gustara el juego, empezaras a jugarlo todos los dÃ­as haciendo que te consuma toda tu vida, lo dejas porque te aburriste, pasan los dÃ­as y te arrepientes de haberlo dejado, y sigues de nuevo con el vicio.

While our "little" bot crisis has certainly taken its toll on the overall enjoyment of the game, I feel like giving it a negative review would go against the 5-6 years of good memories of this game has given me before hand.

It's certainly been an interesting ride with this game, coming into it just as the End Of The Line update dropped. This game not only created connections with people I knew in real life, but also created friendships that would've otherwise never occured in the first place.

It's honestly amazing how this game has managed to keep itself alive and relevant over the years, with many games (especially one, *cough* overwatch *cough*) that was constantly talked about to be the TF2 killer.

With 1,835.5 hours currently on record since 2014, I can honestly say that this game has definately had its ups and downs, but it's never failed to bring a smile to my face, and it's a game I can forsee myself continuing with in the future.
This game is MAGNIFICENT - A Furry Spy Main

[h1]Introduction[/h1]
Team Fortress 2 was developed and published by Valve on October 10th 2007.
It's an FPS game available on Windows, Mac, Linux, PS3 and Xbox 360.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The game uses the same engine as Half-Life 2 to render its graphics. Thanks to being very cartoonishly styled, the models and details mostly still hold up today, but unfortunately the engine of this game pulls it back a lot and limits it from reaching its full potential, due to being so outdated. Nonetheless, the graphics have still arguably aged better than many games from the same time.
[b]7 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The gameplay is incredibly deep, engaging and satisfying. 9 characters may not seem like a lot, but due to how incredibly unique and satisfying to play they are, adding more would most likely hurt the game more than help it. The game's meta is surprisingly deep, considering the competitive mode is pretty much dead and not taken seriously, and an overwhelming majority of the playerbase spends time in casual games or on community servers.
[b]9 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Controls[/h1]
The game has basically the same controls as Half-Life 2, plus some extras, which are very intuitive, straightforward and easy to use. The game also features macros, which are used by some players to quickly perform or automatize certain actions. It also features full gamepad support. All control schemes allow for experiencing the game in its full form.
[b]10 out of 10[/b]

[h1]UI[/h1]
The UI of the game isn't ideal. Stylistically, it fits the game perfectly, however its flaws become clear when you realize how popular custom HUDs for the game are (as well as custom hit and kill sounds). Those mods change the HUD and the UI of the game drastically, improving it greatly in various ways. However, there's mostly nothing wrong with the UI, and it does its job.
[b]5 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Sounds[/h1]
The game's sounds are very satisfying and iconic. The hit and killsounds aren't ideal but can be replaced with mods, just like all other sounds in the game. The voicelines are absolutely amazing, and perfectly reflect each character's personality. The sounds don't feel repetitive or dull.
[b]10 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Music[/h1]
The game has a really good soundtrack in the menu, as well as in the promo videos. Despite having no direct music during gameplay, many of the UI and in-game notification-like sounds, as well as the class selection screen, are composed using little music jingles from the soundtrack, which gives the game its own charm.
[b]9 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Optimization[/h1]
This game is GPU heavy.
There's little reason to install many mods into the game, and even with them the game runs simply really well. The game will work smoothly even on hardware from 10 years ago. If that wasn't enough, there exist configs that make it even more optimized. Everyone, no matter of their hardware, should be able to play this game.
[b]10 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]
The game is incredibly easy to pick up, but hard to master. That means the difficulty is very balanced and allows everyone to shine during matches, no matter of their skill level. Whether you're a casual gamer trying to kill some time or have some fun, or a hardcore gamer who likes to spend incredible amounts of time on figuring out the meta of a single game, this game has you covered.
[b]5 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Unlocks[/h1]
You start with the default weapons for each class, and all of the other weapons get dropped randomly, gradually with time, for free, as you play. You can speed up this process even more by trading in repeats for weapons you don't have using community trading bots, or by using more themed contracts, requiring you to do a certain task with no time limit. This game's unlock system is pretty good and enjoyable.
[b]8 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Story[/h1]
The story of the game isn't directly shown inside the game, but instead mentioned in item descriptions and in-game events, and told using promotional videos and official comics. It's surprisingly deep, and the characters have lots of personality and backstory to them. Overall, the story, despite not being the main focus of the game, is great, especially for an FPS.
[b]9 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Singleplayer[/h1]
The game, beyond the tutorials, the shooting range and rocket jump practice maps, has virtually no singleplayer.
[b]1 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Multiplayer[/h1]
This game is built almost entirely on the multiplayer, allows to play on both official and community-made (vanilla and even modded) servers, in a large variety of gamemodes, and has a very deep meta. The competitive mode is considered dead though.
[b]9 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Community[/h1]
The community may seem off-putting, seeing how bots are plaguing the game, however some slow attempts are being made to make their job harder. Other than that, the community is absolutely amazing, and is working hard to make the game as friendly as possible. Both the casual and community servers are full, people are chatting, posting memes, making animations, trading, speculating, one team of modders is even trying to remake the game in Source 2. The game has a golden community.
[b]10 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Session Time[/h1]
Casual sessions in most gamemodes can vary a lot in time, but usually won't be longer than 10 minutes, with the exception of Capture the Flag, which has no upper time limit, and community servers, which don't have a lower limit either, and sometimes may just be endless games, which don't however punish you for quitting.

[h1]Base Content[/h1]
The game has plenty of base content with its many weapons, gamemodes and sometimes unlockable for free cosmetics and taunts. Most of the content (I'm looking at you, Wutville) is extremely high quality with a lot of heart put into it and fits the theme of the game perfectly.
[b]8 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Gamemodes[/h1]
The game allows for rather broad gamemode choice, with Arena, Capture the Flag, Control Point, Attack/Defend, King of the Hill, Mann vs. Machine (which is basically a horde mode), and variations thereof, which are the most played modes, along with plenty of almost not played ones. All of this gives the players a lot of possibilities for fun.
[b]8 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Custom Content[/h1]
The game's workshop isn't about mods, but instead features community-created cosmetics and taunts, the best of which can be added in the next update of the game if enough people vote on them. This is the reason this game has so many cosmetics. Actual mods aren't very well supported beyond custom HUDs, hit/killsounds and sprays, sadly.
[b]6 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Updates and Support[/h1]
The game receives almost no updates or support whatsoever nowadays, it has been almost entirely forgotten by Valve. Last major update to the game was in 2017. This game is almost entirely community-supported.
[b]2 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Price[/h1]
The game is free to play, so accessible to basically everyone with any wallet.
[b]10 out of 10[/b]

[h1]In-App Purchases[/h1]
The game features lots of store items, most of which (except for the keys) are overly expensive. There's huge potential for purchasing cosmetics though, as well as buying crates to obtain cosmetics, but it's not necessary to play or to progress in any way. There's a premium account feature, allowing to trade items with others and receive some cosmetics for free, but it's accessible for as cheap as $0.75.
[b]8 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Bugs[/h1]
The game features a fair share of bugs, but nothing unusual. It can be compared to Half-Life 2 in terms of bugs.
[b]9 out of 10[/b]

[h1]Worth Playing?[/h1]
Yes. Despite being rather old, it's still a great game to play in 2021, especially for free. The community is keeping it alive enough to be still worth playing today.

Final verdict: [b]Timeless masterpiece of a game, the king of all class shooters.[/b]
